{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3229028,"name":"thenewkid","username":"thenewkid","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/fbc32d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T23:30:22.878Z","cooked":"

We are currently doing some shop clean up and our belt, gear, and sprocket drawers are a mess, how does your team store these things so people can easy get to and see what they have.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T23:30:22.878Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":277,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":1486.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"thenewkid","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23140,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3229031,"name":"Caiden","username":"Huskenator","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/huskenator/{size}/231581_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T23:42:55.728Z","cooked":"


Our team uses these sort of things to organize our different belts, gears, and bolts. We write with sharpie on top of the clear plastic what is in the bin below. They allow for easy transport and access ability

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T23:42:55.728Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":429,"readers_count":428,"score":130.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Caiden","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57884,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Munch"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/2","custom_user_title":"Munch","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229032,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T23:44:06.609Z","cooked":"

This board by 118 is one of my favourite solutions I’ve seen. Some other good suggestions in that thread too.

Organizing FRC COTS Parts (Gears, Belts, Sprockets, Wheels, etc) General Forum
At the robonauts open house we saw this to organize belts [IMG_0390] We are looking to recreate it.

image1380×776 158 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T23:44:31.898Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":412,"readers_count":411,"score":362.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/4/f/4f5248cde5ba80faf1337e74dc371a5d792e40cd.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/organizing-frc-cots-parts-gears-belts-sprockets-wheels-etc/437071/6","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Organizing FRC COTS Parts (Gears, Belts, Sprockets, Wheels, etc)","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":14}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/3","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":13},{"id":"hugs","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229040,"name":"Commonaught","username":"Commonaught","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/commonaught/{size}/197163_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-03T01:08:10.550Z","cooked":"

In our shop we use a pegboard. One peg for each size of gear or sprocket.

Unfortunately we don’t have enough belts and pulleys to warrant a similar solution for those but I imagine it would work well for pulleys. You could even do the same sort of thing that’s shown above with belts by making custom sizes things that slot into the pegboard.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-03T01:08:10.550Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Commonaught","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31336,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4678 - Alumnus, Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/4","custom_user_title":"4678 - Alumnus, Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229064,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-03T11:02:19.571Z","cooked":"

We made these last summer for our gears, sprockets, and pulleys out of 2x4 scraps and pieces of threaded rod we had lying around. It’s made a huge improvement in our ability to keep track of what sizes we have in stock compared to the unsorted box of gears we had previously.

image1920×730 93.5 KB

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-03T11:02:19.571Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":338,"readers_count":337,"score":157.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/7/2/72c7b9a4495eb537db0b01d8bb664f3b5b3ab76b.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/5","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229111,"name":"","username":"Fin87","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-03T17:08:25.022Z","cooked":"

You can sort them by teeth amount and put them in small drawers.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-03T17:08:25.022Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229188,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-03T20:57:33.515Z","cooked":"

I have a bunch of those for organizing my Lego parts. They are really nice because the removable bins can be swapped around so one can have more or less of a particular size in one unit. The bins also “engage” with the ridges in the lid so that small, thin parts, like washers, don’t escape.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-03T20:57:33.515Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57884,"username":"Huskenator","name":"Caiden","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/huskenator/{size}/231581_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229239,"name":"Nicholas ","username":"unident","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-04T01:57:50.790Z","cooked":"

Specifically the DeWalt model pictured is solid and I’d like to get some for 2851’s pit. My favorite because they balance price and functionality. Having used Milwaukee ($$$), Stanley, HDX/anvil, Harbor Freight, Ridgid, you name it. this one takes the cake in my book. They also sell a deep version.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-04T01:57:50.790Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Nicholas ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57884,"username":"Huskenator","name":"Caiden","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/huskenator/{size}/231581_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229244,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-04T02:37:01.456Z","cooked":"

I picked up my Dewalt storage units when Home Depot had them on sale for around $11 a few years ago. I’ve seen them on sale again since but at a higher price.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-04T02:38:02.038Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":80.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55833,"username":"unident","name":"Nicholas ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229262,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-04T04:23:36.168Z","cooked":"

I picked up 10 of the dewalt “shallow” units at homedepot in the US for the team last year over blackfriday while I was on vacation.

$11USD each was a price we couldn’t pass up! We’re looking to get some more this year and I’m hoping another sale pops up .

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-04T04:23:36.168Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":215,"readers_count":214,"score":88.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":15467,"username":"philso","name":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/10","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229776,"name":"Jim Smith","username":"Rainydaymaker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rainydaymaker/{size}/155036_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-06T16:34:58.407Z","cooked":"

We store them on the wall above a door. We laser cut wood hooks and mounted that to a backer board screwed to the wall. Big labels on each belt and a hook on a pole to get them down.

20230905_1253321920×2560 343 KB

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-06T16:34:58.407Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"Jim Smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/c/acb6789d11057981bcb787f178e0f92ee58c9af9.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16700,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Smith"},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/11","custom_user_title":"Jim Smith","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229781,"name":"snichols","username":"snichols","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/d78d45/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-09-06T16:42:57.772Z","cooked":"

Whatever system you choose, I’m a big proponent of labeling each gear and pulley with the number of teeth as soon as it comes out of the bag (yes, even if it’s going straight from the bag onto the robot). Black sharpie for gears, silver sharpie for black pulleys. No matter how well you organize them, you will still sometimes find one sitting on a table and either no one knows how many teeth it has, or someone is “pretty sure…” Do yourself a favor and just label them.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2023-09-06T16:43:51.578Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":67.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":440425,"topic_slug":"how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets","display_username":"snichols","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27696,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-does-your-team-store-belts-gears-and-sprockets/440425/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3229785,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-06T17:05:17.753Z","cooked":"

The problem I’ve found with the Dewalt boxes is there is at least 3 different versions and none of them work with each other. We also have 2 different Husky cases that don’t work with each other i just just saw a 3rd version the other day that doesn’t seem like it will work with the other 2. The cases are nice but can be frustrating when they don’t connect with each other

Edit: I may have found a partial solution to the dewalt box issue.

That adapter plate works with like the 4 different styles of dewalt boxes. It is intended to go on top of a tough system box then you can put any of the other styles on that. It is dual sided so you could potentially sandwich it between a t-stak and a compartment box. I bought one to fiddle with at practice tomorrow. Only thing is, it is a little pricey at $25 but if it soothes my OCD its worth it

$25 is more than a single box of any type at Home Depot. Don’t know how I’m gonna justify that one lol.

regarding your rack, the length isn’t very modular as the way the attachment points are done on the back means that we couldn’t really get it to a length we’d like. we also have shelves currently that sorta do the job but if they ever somehow magically break i think we’d definitely consider replacing with these.
